name: APlayerCameraManager
doc:
A PlayerCameraManager is responsible for managing the camera for a particular
player. It defines the final view properties used by other systems (e.g. the renderer),
meaning you can think of it as your virtual eyeball in the world. It can compute the
final camera properties directly, or it can arbitrate/blend between other objects or
actors that influence the camera (e.g. blending from one CameraActor to another).

The PlayerCameraManagers primary external responsibility is to reliably respond to
various Get*() functions, such as GetCameraViewPoint. Most everything else is
implementation detail and overrideable by user projects.

By default, a PlayerCameraManager maintains a "view target", which is the primary actor
the camera is associated with. It can also apply various "post" effects to the final
view state, such as camera animations, shakes, post-process effects or special
effects such as dirt on the lens.

@see https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Gameplay/Framework/Camera/

TransformComponent: Dummy component we can use to attach things to the camera.
DefaultOrthoWidth: The default desired width (in world units) of the orthographic view (ignored in Perspective mode)
DefaultAspectRatio: Default aspect ratio. Most of the time the value from a camera component will be used instead.
DefaultModifiers: List of modifiers to create by default for this camera
FreeCamDistance: Distance to place free camera from view target (used in certain CameraStyles)
FreeCamOffset: Offset to Z free camera position (used in certain CameraStyles)
ViewTargetOffset: Offset to view target (used in certain CameraStyles)
OnAudioFadeChangeEvent: If bound, broadcast on fade start (with fade time) instead of manually altering audio device's primary volume directly
AutoPlaneShift: Manually adjusts the planes of this camera, maintaining the distance between them. Positive moves out to the farplane, negative towards the near plane
bIsOrthographic: True when this camera should use an orthographic perspective instead of FOV
bAutoCalculateOrthoPlanes: True when this camera should automatically calculated the Near+Far planes
bUpdateOrthoPlanes: Adjusts the near/far planes and the view origin of the current camera automatically to avoid clipping and light artefacting
bUseCameraHeightAsViewTarget: If UpdateOrthoPlanes is enabled, this setting will use the cameras current height to compensate the distance to the general view (as a pseudo distance to view target when one isn't present)
bDefaultConstrainAspectRatio: True if black bars should be added if the destination view has a different aspect ratio (only used when a view target doesn't specify whether or not to constrain the aspect ratio; most of the time the value from a camera component is used instead)
bClientSimulatingViewTarget: True if clients are handling setting their own viewtarget and the server should not replicate it.
bUseClientSideCameraUpdates: True if server will use camera positions replicated from the client instead of calculating them locally.
bGameCameraCutThisFrame:
True if we did a camera cut this frame. Automatically reset to false every frame.
This flag affects various things in the renderer (such as whether to use the occlusion queries from last frame, and motion blur).

methods.name: AddNewCameraModifier
BlueprintUpdateCamera
methods.doc:
Blueprint hook to allow blueprints to override existing camera behavior or implement custom cameras.
If this function returns true, we will use the given returned values and skip further calculations to determine
final camera POV.

methods.name: ClearCameraLensEffects
methods.doc: Removes all camera lens effects.

methods.name: FindCameraModifierByClass
methods.doc:
Returns camera modifier for this camera of the given class, if it exists.
Exact class match only. If there are multiple modifiers of the same class, the first one is returned.

methods.name: GetCameraLocation
methods.doc: Returns camera's current location.

methods.name: GetCameraRotation
methods.doc: Returns camera's current rotation.

methods.name: GetFOVAngle
methods.doc: Returns the camera's current full FOV angle, in degrees.

methods.name: GetOwningPlayerController
methods.doc: Returns the PlayerController that owns this camera.

methods.name: OnPhotographyMultiPartCaptureEnd
methods.doc:
Event triggered upon the end of a multi-part photograph capture, when manual
free-roaming photographic camera control is about to be returned to the user.
Here you may re-enable whatever was turned off within
OnPhotographyMultiPartCaptureStart.

methods.name: OnPhotographyMultiPartCaptureStart
methods.doc:
Event triggered upon the start of a multi-part photograph capture (i.e. a
stereoscopic or 360-degree shot).  This is an ideal time to turn off
rendering effects that tile badly (UI, subtitles, vignette, very aggressive
bloom, etc; most of these are automatically disabled when
r.Photography.AutoPostprocess is 1).

methods.name: OnPhotographySessionEnd
methods.doc:
Event triggered upon leaving Photography mode (after unpausing, if
r.Photography.AutoPause is 1).

methods.name: OnPhotographySessionStart
methods.doc:
Event triggered upon entering Photography mode (before pausing, if
r.Photography.AutoPause is 1).

methods.name: PhotographyCameraModify
methods.doc:
Implementable blueprint hook to allow a PlayerCameraManager subclass to
constrain or otherwise modify the camera during free-camera photography.
For example, a blueprint may wish to limit the distance from the camera's
original point, or forbid the camera from passing through walls.
NewCameraLocation contains the proposed new camera location.
PreviousCameraLocation contains the camera location in the previous frame.
OriginalCameraLocation contains the camera location before the game was put
into photography mode.
Return ResultCameraLocation as modified according to your constraints.

methods.name: RemoveCameraModifier
methods.doc:
Removes the given camera modifier from this camera (if it's on the camera in the first place) and discards it.
@return True if successfully removed, false otherwise.

methods.name: SetGameCameraCutThisFrame
methods.doc: Sets the bGameCameraCutThisFrame flag to true (indicating we did a camera cut this frame; useful for game code to call, e.g., when performing a teleport that should be seamless)

methods.name: SetManualCameraFade
methods.doc:
Turns on camera fading at the given opacity. Does not auto-animate, allowing user to animate themselves.
Call StopCameraFade to turn fading back off.

methods.name: StartCameraFade
StartCameraShake
StartCameraShakeFromSource
StopAllCameraShakes
methods.doc: Stops all active camera shakes on this camera.

methods.name: StopAllCameraShakesFromSource
methods.doc: Stops playing all shakes originating from the given source.

methods.name: StopAllInstancesOfCameraShake
methods.doc: Stops playing all shakes of the given class.

methods.name: StopAllInstancesOfCameraShakeFromSource
methods.doc: Stops playing all shakes of the given class originating from the given source.

methods.name: StopCameraFade
methods.doc: Stops camera fading.

methods.name: StopCameraShake
methods.doc: Immediately stops the given shake instance and invalidates it.
